verse: Then Solomon began to build the House of the Lord at Jerusalem on Mount Moriah, where the Lord had appeared to his father David. He constructed it on the site that David had specified, namely, the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
He began building on the second day of the second month in the fourth year of his reign.
Now these are the dimensions of the foundations which Solomon laid for the building of Godâ€™s house. The length was ninety feet and the width thirty feet.
The porch that was in front of the temple building was thirty feet wide, the same as the width of the building, and it was thirty feet high.
He lined the larger front room of the building with fir paneling, which he overlaid with fine gold and decorated with palm trees and chains.
He beautified the house with dazzling precious stones. The gold was gold of Parvaim.
He also overlaid the house, the beams and rafters, the thresholds and door frames, its walls, and its doors with gold, and he carved cherubim on the walls.
He made the Most Holy Place. It was thirty feet by thirty feet, the same dimensions as the width of the building, and he overlaid it with six hundred talents of fine gold.
The weight of the gold nails was more than a pound. He overlaid the upper areas with gold.
In the Most Holy Place he made two carved cherubim that were overlaid with gold.

The total wingspan of the cherubim was thirty feet. One wing of the first cherub was seven and a half feet long and touched the outer wall of the house. The other wing was also seven and a half feet long and touched the wing of the other cherub.
One wing of the other cherub was seven and a half feet long and touched the outer wall of the house. The other wing was also seven and a half feet long and touched the wing of the first cherub.
The wings of these cherubim spread out over thirty feet. They stood upright on their feet, and they faced toward the front of the sanctuary building.
He made the veil of blue, purple, and crimson material and fine white linen, and he decorated it with cherubim.
For the front of the house he made two pillars with a combined height of fifty-three feet, and the capitals that were on top of each of them were seven and a half feet tall.
He made chains for the inner sanctuary and also put them on the tops of the pillars. He also made one hundred pomegranates and put them on the chains.
He set up the pillars in front of the temple building, one on the south side and the other on the north. He named the one on the south Jakin and the one on the north Boaz.
